thread.title: Reijnen escapes serious injury after Dwars door Vlaanderen crash
thread.title_full: Reijnen escapes serious injury after Dwars door Vlaanderen crash

title: Reijnen escapes serious injury after Dwars door Vlaanderen crash
text:
Reijnen escapes serious injury after Dwars door Vlaanderen crash Trek-Segafredo rider hoping to be racing again next weekend 1 / 5 Kiel Reijnen (Trek-Segafredo) cools down after a hot day in the saddle (Tim de Waele/TDWSport.com) Kiel Reijnen wins stage 5 at the 2016 Tour of Utah (Jonathan Devich/epicimages.us) 5 / 5 Kiel Reijnen walks his bike across the line during stage 1 of the Tour of Utah after contact with another rider left his front wheel inoperable. (Jonathan Devich/epicimages.us) Kiel Reijnen (Trek-Segafredo) is hoping to be back to racing this weekend despite suffering a heavy crash at Dwars door Vlaanderen on Wednesday. Related Articles Kiel Reijnen: A late bloomer Reijen was in the bunch with around 50 kilometres left of the race when he was seen veering off the road and into a field. Television images moments later showed him in a large ditch at the side of the road being attended to by the race’s medical staff. 
The scene was concerning but his team allayed fears for his wellbeing with a post on their Twitter account saying: “All good! @Kielreijnen has a sore neck, but nothing broken, and will be ready to race again Sunday. # DDV.” 
Alongside the comment was a photo of Reijnen, with a hospital band on his wrist, giving the thumbs up to the camera, outside the team’s hotel on the outskirts of Bruges. 
Trek-Segafredo had hoped to be in contention for a good result at Dwars door Vlaanderen but, in the end, Eduard Theuns was their best finisher in 31st. 
Reijnen is expected to race at this Sunday’s Gent-Wevelgem. All good! @Kielreijnen has a sore neck, but nothing broken, and will be ready to race again Sunday. #DDV pic.twitter.com/hOe0Br18A9
